intro: Wahlenbergia brevisquamifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
